Students gain contextual information regarding yearbook roles in history and memory along with practical
skills for recruitment, staff organization, staffing and production, and incorporating the creation of the

employed by PR practitioners. Course also explores the history and social role of public relations as well as
ethics and social responsibility.

Perspectives, skills needed to manage an organization's PR function, particularly strategic planning,
implementation and evaluation. Emphasis on managerial aspects of negotiating organizational relationships
with publics.

Provides an in-depth study of social media and public relations, emphasizing how the two are used by
organizations to build stronger relations with consumers, media, analysts, and others.

Description:
Focuses on public relations writing and strategic messaging, a critical foundational skill. Course content
includes skill building in online channels and across traditional mediums.

Prerequisites: JMC 68000 and 68001; and journalism and mass communication(JMC) major; and graduate standing.
Description:
Explores the theory and application of ethics in public relations. Examines case studies, ethics theory, values
and management thought.

Description:
Examines development of Public Relations as a profession, focusing on the Twentieth Century. Detailed study
of historical case studies, campaigns and initiatives.

Explores strategies and tactics of internal communications. Includes development of organizational intranets
and other employee-focused communications channels with special emphasis on social media to communicate
public relations messages.

Description:
Focuses on financial topics related to a career in public relations, particularly the role of communicators in the
growing field of investor relations.

Introduction to theory of mass communication with emphasis on the process and effects of mass
communication.

Investigates how the law affects those who gather information and publish online, including issues relating to
blogging, web site hosting,posting and online journalism, along with a basic ability to apply that knowledge in
specific situations. Focus is on both existing law and developing public policy.

Description:
COLLECTION

focus on human subjects and textual data.
